Posts.Content: Some States have insurance plans that cover a great deal at low cost. There are private co pay funds you can research. There are three I know of but they all have exceeded their resources. There is a site needymeds.com or .org that has a list of some of the funds. Don't give up on these funds sometimes they open - and can close quickly.
Posts.Title: Need zytiga funding

Posts.Content: Anyone live in a medical cannabis state? I was interested in your experiences. Thanks
Posts.Title: Medical Cannabis? Worth a try, I understand it can be helpful.

Posts.Content: I waited after initial treatment to start hormone therapy. Every decision from now on will be difficult. I restarted hormone therapy at PSA 19. We were waiting for PSA to go to 10. This is a good example of how fast the cancer can grow. I suspected this jump was a bone met. It was. Switched to Dana Farber and went into multi agent treatment protocol. Lupron, Taxotere, Avastin. Six cycles. PSA 0.03. But it didn't stay low for too long. So, my opinion is fight hard but this is long battle, save as much ammunition as possible. With 4 New treatments in the market in 4 years. Comtreq a year or so away. New technologies are making progress, combo therapies, 2nd generation immunology. You'll be on this board a long time. GL
Posts.Title: What to Do about Conflicting Advice

Posts.Content: Hello 9 can be a challenge but your Dad seems to have a well behaved variant. I would suggest you visit a good clinic if possible. I go to Dana Farber and they run many trials and combination drug trials. If you go to their website you can find specific trials. Many are for recently diagnosed and treated. So much has changed in the past 4-5 years I would see what might be a decision that can add years to your Dad's survival. GL

Posts.Content: Yes, the drug is worth it. It not only will extend your life but improve your quality of life. Go fishing with your son. In a quite place the best answer will become clear. GL
Posts.Title: Sarg, chuck, advice anyone

Posts.Content: Confirmation of scan results which show hot spots for tumors or calcium deposits. Just a second opinion tool, I would say. My doctor mainly used cat scans and bone scans. I needed local radiation and that doctor used xray to see the Mets.
Posts.Title: bone scan?

Posts.Content: Opoman, how has Xtandi worked out? I started on X about six weeks ago. First four weeks were bad. Seemed like no effect at all. PAS was 156 when I started. More pain than I had experienced. Last two weeks I feel good. Regaining strength, sleeping is still erratic but will stabilize once I find the right dose of pain killers. My opiate intake has decreased by 50% in last two weeks. My main comment on X is Don't panic if PSA is not much lower or the same. X did not show great effect in the P3 trial. GL
Posts.Title: Xtandi, and Samarium 153

Posts.Content: For your wife's sake and your peace of mind go to a qualified clinic, hospital or urologist. This happened to me 7.5 years ago and was PC!!!! High grade, PSA rising quickly. Don't panic. Best Wishes
Posts.Title: 27 w/ prostate issues, just ejaculated blood. Any explanation?

Posts.Content: Yes, 3 I know of. Link removed per new user policy Patient Advocate Network Copay org Chronic Disease Fund They all seem to be on hold so look for openings. GL
Posts.Title: Zytiga question

Posts.Content: Normal to run a scan. PSA is not a measure of cancer volume or locations. If the scan is clean your initial treatment options won't (IMO) be limited.
